projectContent.text: City on “desert”. Wild desert. Jungle muted into concrete. Concrete designed with multiple shapes that cover the horizontal and raise on the vertical, forming columns and buildings. In the underground and the outskirts, an enjoyment of life that goes beyond the imposed shapes in the designs of streets and buildings. Voices, stories, whispers, recalls, memories and bodies that speak of this urban core beyond the monument. This is an archaeology about the life in Brasilia, a tribute to the pioneers, who brought the ideas but also the hands, and who with their ardour brought the city alive.
Art residency program in Casa de la cultura de América Latina. Brasilia, Brasil. 2017
*With the support of Organización de Estados Iberoamericanos OEI, Casa da Cultura de América Latina, Arquivo público de Brasilia.*
